Bootswatch Themed QMD

Published

January 5, 2023

Plots

This is the world’s most amazing plot. Everyone loves penguins.

Penguins are fancy.

There are 344 in the dataset of interest.

Show the code
penguins %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point()

You can also include tables. Tables are super cool. I love tables and I love penguins. I am subject to oversight by the penguin overlords. The eternals are friends with the penguins.

Show the code
penguins %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  group_by(species, sex) %>% 
  rename(
    body_mass = body_mass_g, bill_length = bill_length_mm, 
    bill_depth = bill_depth_mm
    ) %>% 
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    across(
      .cols = c(body_mass, bill_length, bill_depth),
      .fns = list(mean = mean, sd = sd)
    ),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>% 
  gt(rowname_col = "sex") %>% 
  cols_label(
    n = "N", body_mass_mean = "Mean", body_mass_sd = "SD", 
    bill_length_mean= "Mean", bill_length_sd = "SD",
    bill_depth_mean = "Mean", bill_depth_sd = "SD"
    ) %>% 
  gt::tab_spanner(
    label = "Body Mass (g)",
    columns = 4:5
  ) %>% 
  gt::tab_spanner(
    label = "Bill Length (mm)",
    columns = 6:7
  ) %>% 
  gt::tab_spanner(
    label = "Bill Depth (mm)",
    columns = 8:9
  ) %>% 
  fmt_number(
    columns = c(where(is.numeric), -n)
  )
species N Body Mass (g) Bill Length (mm) Bill Depth (mm)
Mean SD Mean SD Mean SD
female Adelie 73 3,368.84 269.38 37.26 2.03 17.62 0.94
male Adelie 73 4,043.49 346.81 40.39 2.28 19.07 1.02
female Chinstrap 34 3,527.21 285.33 46.57 3.11 17.59 0.78
male Chinstrap 34 3,938.97 362.14 51.09 1.56 19.25 0.76
female Gentoo 58 4,679.74 281.58 45.56 2.05 14.24 0.54
male Gentoo 61 5,484.84 313.16 49.47 2.72 15.72 0.74
